TestDescription.name: Microsoft ASP.NET Forms authentication bypass

WASPDescription.DetailsFormat: The script has been tested with these parameter values : ${combinations}

TestDescription.Description: The Forms Authentication feature in the ASP.NET subsystem in Microsoft .NET Framework 1.1 SP1, 2.0 SP2, 3.5 SP1, 3.5.1, and 4.0 allows remote authenticated users to obtain access to arbitrary user accounts via a crafted username. [break]
TestDescription.Impact: By exploiting this vulnerability an attacker is able to log on as a different existing user with all the privileges of the targeted user (e.g. admin).
TestDescription.Recommendation:
Immediately apply the MS11-100 patch: http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/security/bulletin/ms11-100. [break][break]
Workaround: [break]In .NET 4.0 the vulnerability can be mitigated by setting the ticketCompatibilityMode attribute in the application or global web.config file like this:[break][break] [code][pre] <system.web> <authentication mode="Forms"> <forms ticketCompatibilityMode="Framework40" /> </authentication> </system.web> [/pre][/code]
